tool.name: AnisotropicFilter

param.name: niter
param.dialogReference: The number of passes the filter will make. Higher values correspond to coarser smoothing.

param.name: estimate_k
param.dialogReference: Determines whether the K value(s) will be estimated according to the method described in [C. Tsiotsios, M. Petrou "On the choice of the parameters for anisotropic diffusion in image processing, Pattern Recognition" (2012), http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.patcog.2012.11.012], or provided by the user. Estimation is recommended for more accurate smoothing, but can be bypassed if reasonable K values are already known.

param.name: k
param.dialogReference:
The edge preserving threshold (minimum slope to define an edge).

Only valid if estimate_k is False. If no k2 value is provided, k defines the threshold of both vertical and horizontal slope directions. Otherwise, k defines the threshold in only the vertical direction (see k2).

param.name: k2
param.dialogReference: The edge preserving threshold in the horizontal direction of the DEM. Only valid when estimate_k is False and a value for k is provided. Smoothing using separately-tuned thresholds for the vertical and horizontal slope directions can result in more accurately defined features in the output.

param.name: sigma
param.dialogReference: The input to the gaussian smoothing applied to the DEM when estimating k values. Specifying a sigma value bypasses the most costly step of the estimation algorithm.

param.name: outname
param.dialogReference: The desired path to the smoothed output raster file.

tool.summary: Smooths the input DEM using Perona-Malik anisotropic diffusion to preserve terrain feature edges.
